notes: poss. only in loans, but other Mayan languages have this as a normal phoneme, too

contrary to what one might expect, this does not occur in Spanish loans but in words that look native. However, it's so much rarer than the „normal“ n (384 vs. 44,532 utterances) that it seems unlikely to be a regular phoneme. We're assuming here that it's a typo of ⟨n⟩.
this is actually ṵː but that breaks R studio
